_meta.purpose: Alternative framings for internal consideration only
_meta.note: These variants are INTERNAL DRAFTS only. They do not represent approved direction and require HR_PRE approval before any use.

variants.name: Regulatory Gap Focus
variants.framing: Emphasizes regulatory gap as primary opportunity driver
variants.executive_summary: A significant regulatory gap in renewable energy policy has been identified, creating an opportunity for proactive policy development. Industry signals strongly indicate market readiness, and agency rulemaking announcements suggest a window for influence.
variants.stakeholder_strategy: Position as filling regulatory void rather than disrupting existing framework
variants.opposition_mitigation: Frame as regulatory modernization, not industry disruption
variants.use_case: If regulatory gap is the strongest signal

variants.name: Coalition Building Focus
variants.framing: Emphasizes early coalition building with high-influence allies
variants.executive_summary: High-influence stakeholders on both sides require early coalition building. The Renewable Energy Coalition's high influence and support position provides a strong foundation, while early engagement can preempt opposition mobilization.
variants.stakeholder_strategy: Engage Renewable Energy Coalition immediately, build momentum before opposition organizes
variants.opposition_mitigation: Build sufficient coalition strength to counter high-influence opponent
variants.use_case: If stakeholder dynamics are the primary consideration

variants.name: Risk Mitigation Focus
variants.framing: Emphasizes opposition risk and mitigation strategies
variants.executive_summary: Medium opposition risk with early warning indicators requires proactive risk mitigation. High-influence opponent (Traditional Energy Association) demands careful framing and counter-narrative preparation before policy development proceeds.
variants.stakeholder_strategy: Prepare opposition response strategy before engaging allies
variants.opposition_mitigation: Develop comprehensive counter-narrative and framing strategy
variants.use_case: If opposition risk is the primary concern

variants.name: Balanced Multi-Signal Approach
variants.framing: Balances all signals equally - regulatory gap, coalition building, and risk mitigation
variants.executive_summary: Multiple converging signals create a policy opportunity: regulatory gaps, industry readiness, agency rulemaking windows, and stakeholder dynamics. A balanced approach that addresses all factors simultaneously provides the strongest foundation.
variants.stakeholder_strategy: Engage allies while preparing opposition response, leverage regulatory window
variants.opposition_mitigation: Multi-pronged approach: coalition strength + counter-narrative + strategic framing
variants.use_case: If all signals are equally important

selection_guidance.note: Variant selection should be based on strategic priorities and risk tolerance
factors: Which signal is strongest (regulatory gap vs stakeholder dynamics vs opposition risk)
selection_guidance.recommendation: Variant selection requires human strategic judgment and cannot be automated

disclaimer: These variants are INTERNAL DRAFTS for consideration only. They do not represent approved policy direction. HR_PRE approval is required before any variant can be used. No variant may be treated as authoritative.
